body_html:
In fact, it does. The padded_shapes=[None] argument in your code snippet is wrong: that argument must match the structure of the input dataset, which means in this case that it must be a dictionary mapping 'x' and 'y' to the appropriately padded shapes. The following replacement works:

dataset = dataset.padded_batch(4, padded_shapes={'x': [None], 'y': [None]})
body_text:
In fact, it does. The padded_shapes=[None] argument in your code snippet is wrong: that argument must match the structure of the input dataset, which means in this case that it must be a dictionary mapping 'x' and 'y' to the appropriately padded shapes. The following replacement works:
dataset = dataset.padded_batch(4, padded_shapes={'x': [None], 'y': [None]})
body:
In fact, it does. The `padded_shapes=[None]` argument in your code snippet is wrong: that argument must match the structure of the input dataset, which means in this case that it must be a dictionary mapping `'x'` and `'y'` to the appropriately padded shapes. The following replacement works:

```python
dataset = dataset.padded_batch(4, padded_shapes={'x': [None], 'y': [None]})
```
